humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, there is metastatic carcinoma present in 14 out of 16 right axillary lymph nodes (AJCC pN3). This meets the criteria for N3 as per New Rule 13. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for cancer staging is determined by the presence and extent of lymph node involvement. In this pathology report, it is stated that a single sentinel lymph node is positive for metastatic carcinoma and multiple (14 out of 16) axillary lymph nodes are also positive for metastatic carcinoma. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N3, as this indicates the presence of cancer in 4 or more axillary lymph nodes.
